ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Adding Key Value to CrawlURI in 2.0.2
ygData.msgSnippet: The Key mechanism is for configurable settings, rather than dynamic state that varies for different URIs. Instead use the getData() method of CrawlURI to get

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Adding Key Value to CrawlURI in 2.0.2
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=tV0lKvXtjX4ehtB0xK0Cwm6ZM96QY7YAVS-PbOf3CJaX
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

The 'Key' mechanism is for configurable settings, rather than dynamic 
state that varies for different URIs.

Instead use the getData() method of CrawlURI to get a 
HashMap<String,Object> into which you can store arbitrary state for 
later Processors.

(This data doesn't survive the URI being put back onto a queue -- for 
example if it needs to be retried after certain kinds of errors. For 
that, or for data that should be 'inherited' by other URIs discovered 
via the current CrawlURI, look at the addPersistentDataMapKey() or 
makeHeritable() methods. If using either of these, make sure the extra 
state you add serializes/deserializes cleanly.)

Also, do you need particular features only present in Heritrix 2.0.2? If 
not, I recommend using 1.14.3; it is still better documented and more 
proven in production environments than the 2.0.x line.

In 1.14.3, the same general mechanisms exist but the implementing 
methods/classes are slightly different:

2.0.x                        1.14.3
getData()                 -> getAlist()
addPersistentDataMapKey() -> addAlistPersistentMember()
makeHeritable()           -> makeHeritable()

- Gordon @ IA

sendaman69 wrote:
> Hi all,
> 
> I'm computing a relevance score of each URI based on the HTML content of the URI in a processor and an external IE prorgam. I would like to use this score to set the precendence for the extracted links of the URI.
> 
> How do I add this score to the CrawlURI/ProcessorURI so I can access it in another Processor?
> 
> I have looked into the Key class but didn't really get the concept of it and it seems I only can set on static final values?!?
> 
> Hope this makes sense...it's kinda late in the night here...
> 
> Thanks much in advance!
> 
> Georgie
